items.title: Lotus Cars appoints new China president
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Lotus Cars has appointed Peiji Qin as the new president of its operations in China as of March 12.
- Qin reports directly to CEO Feng Qingfeng and has over 15 years of experience in the Geely ecosystem, including roles at Volvo, Geely, and Polestar.
- Former president Mao Jingbo is now the global chief sales officer, overseeing global production, sales coordination, and marketing resource integration.
- The leadership changes are aimed at enhancing Lotus’ presence in the Chinese market and supporting global brand development and expansion efforts.

items.title: China summons Walmart over supplier pricing cut amid tariffs
items.summary:
- China summoned Walmart executives for regulatory talks on March 11 regarding pricing pressures on Chinese suppliers.
- Concerns arise about Walmart pushing suppliers to lower prices amid U.S. tariffs affecting financial burdens.
- The discussions may lead to further action before upcoming bilateral trade negotiations due to increasing economic tensions.

items.title: GoTo’s Q4 losses narrow to $56m as adjusted EBITDA surges
Omnia acquires AI-driven AR startup SpotKwik
items.summary:
- Omnia, a United States-based extended reality firm, acquires SpotKwik, an acclaimed augmented reality startup.
- The financial details of the acquisition remain undisclosed.
- SpotKwik, founded in 2019, originally focused on B2C social commerce through AR in influencer marketing, then shifted to a B2B model.
- Co-founder and CEO Mithun Adith highlights the partnership's aim to transition from mobile computing to spatial computing.

items.title: From Test to T20: India’s unicorn game
Bessemer Venture Partners launches $350m fund for Indian startups
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Bessemer Venture Partners has launched its second dedicated India fund worth US$350 million.
- The fund focuses on early-stage startups in sectors such as AI, SaaS, fintech, digital health, consumer brands, and cybersecurity.
- The firm has a nearly 20-year presence in Bangalore and has invested in over 80 Indian startups, including notable ones like BigBasket and Urban Company.
- Over 80% of Bessemer’s investments in India in the past five years have been at the series A stage or earlier.
- Vishal Gupta and Anant Vidur Puri will oversee the investment strategy in India.

items.title: 20 largest exits in India
Healthtech startup Allo Health bags $1.8m pre-series A
items.summary:
- Allo Health, a Bengaluru-based health startup, raised ₹16 crore (approximately US$1.83 million) in a pre-series A funding round led by Rainmatter.
- The funds will be utilized to expand its network of clinics and enhance AI-driven treatment frameworks.
- Allo Health operates over 35 clinics in major Indian cities and has treated over 200,000 patients since launch.
- This funding follows a US$4.4 million seed round led by Nexus Venture Partners, with investments from notable figures like Flipkart's Binny Bansal and Zomato's Deepinder Goyal.
- The startup focuses on a hybrid healthcare model that combines physical clinics with technology-driven treatment.

items.title: OpenAI develops AI for creative writing
items.summary:
- OpenAI has launched an AI tool specifically designed for creative writing.
- This tool aims to assist writers in generating ideas, enhancing storytelling, and improving their writing process.
- The initiative is part of OpenAI's broader efforts to expand AI applications in creative fields.

items.title: Chinese retail investors embrace AI use for stock trading
items.summary:
- Chinese retail investors are increasingly utilizing AI tools like DeepSeek for stock trading.
- This represents a shift from the backlash against quantitative trading seen last year.
- Investors are learning to use AI tools through workshops and online courses.
- DeepSeek, developed by High-Flyer in Hangzhou, aids traders in assessing companies and selecting stocks.
- Trader Wen Hao notes that these tools improve trading efficiency and save time.
- Recent developments of DeepSeek include a rise in downloads, open-source AI projects, and discounted API access during off-peak hours.

items.title: Y Combinator founders opt for smaller VC rounds
items.summary:
- A shift is happening in Silicon Valley’s startup ecosystem with Y Combinator founders choosing smaller VC funding rounds despite growth.
- AI startups are generating significant revenue while keeping employee counts low.
- Founders are focusing on ownership retention and operational flexibility, preferring less VC involvement.
- Analysts caution that well-funded competitors might have advantages in scaling and product development.

items.title: Razorpay eyes profitability ahead of IPO, expands to SG
items.author: Shashank Kumar
items.summary:
- Razorpay aims for group-wide profitability in preparation for a potential IPO within three years.
- The core payments business is currently profitable, with a reported net income of US$4 million in FY24.
- Expansion into Singapore took place in March, with plans to enter Thailand, Vietnam, the Philippines, and the Middle East, targeting US$5 billion in payment volume from these regions focusing on real-time and cross-border payments.

items.title: Google to invest $750m more in Anthropic, total tops $3b
items.summary:
- Google holds a 14% stake in AI startup Anthropic and plans to invest US$750 million more in 2025.
- Total investment in Anthropic will exceed US$3 billion; however, Google has no voting rights or board representation.
- This investment raises concerns about Anthropic's independence amid regulatory scrutiny of tech giants' partnerships with AI firms.
- Amazon also agreed to invest up to US$8 billion in Anthropic, further connecting major tech firms with AI startups.

items.title: A price to pay for a separate Amazon Pay
items.author: Miguel
items.summary:
- Amazon is considering launching a standalone payments app in India to compete with Google Pay and PhonePe.
- The goal is to offer a comprehensive financial service including payments, loans, insurance, and more.
- Yuno, a US payment firm, has launched its regional HQ in Qatar to integrate into the local fintech ecosystem, in line with Qatar’s ambition to grow as a fintech hub.

items.title: Indonesia’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- The article examines the top-funded tech companies in Indonesia over the last decade.
- It highlights trends in funding and investment within the Indonesian startup ecosystem.
- Key companies and their funding amounts are discussed, showcasing the growth of the tech industry in the region.

items.title: Ola Electric shares drop 4.4%, reaches record low
items.summary:
- Ola Electric shares declined by 4.4% to hit an all-time low.
- The drop reflects ongoing market concerns about the company's performance.
- Investors are analyzing factors behind the decline and potential recovery plans.

items.title: Uber to deploy 1,000 EVs with Refex in India by 2026
items.author: Aditya Kapoor, Sachin Navtosh Jha
items.summary:
- Uber plans to deploy 1,000 electric vehicles in partnership with Refex Green Mobility by 2026, targeting major Indian cities.
- This initiative supports Uber’s goal of achieving 100% emission-free rides globally by 2040.
- The collaboration aims to enhance electric vehicle adoption in India and contributes to the country’s sustainability objectives.

items.title: Samsung boosts R&D, facility spending to record high
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics announced its largest annual spending on R&D and facility expansion in 2024, as reported on Mar. 11.
- Allocated about 35 trillion won (US$24.1 billion) to R&D, a 23.5% increase from 2023.
- Facility investments reached a record 53.6 trillion won (US$36.9 billion), rising by 500 billion won (US$344 million) despite a tough global market.
- Annual revenue hit 300.87 trillion won (US$207.3 billion) with a net profit increase of 122.5% to 34.45 trillion won (US$23.7 billion).

items.title: Brazil may revive fintech transaction reporting rule
items.summary:
- Brazil’s tax revenue service plans to revisit the requirement for fintechs to report transactions due to money laundering concerns.
- Robinson Barreirinhas, head of the agency, stated that current tools for tracking financial activities are not being used for fintechs.
- Proposed regulations for fintech reporting were suspended last year following public opposition.
- A regulation introduced in September 2023 aimed to align fintech reporting with banks but was delayed in January 2024 due to backlash.
- Barreirinhas cited links between organized crime in Brazil and smuggling, cryptocurrencies, and online betting.
